column3:
Problem here seems to be that it thinks boost is a framework when it isn't.
I would think that this would cause a runtime failure, since boost_system isn't being packaged. If it doesn't, it must mean that boost_system is already packaged and then it tries it again for some reason as a framework and fails.
Could you give a few details on your boost install please?
- How is it installed
- otool

boost was installed via homebrew (bottled).

```
$ cd /usr/local/lib && otool -LD libboost_system-mt.dylib
libboost_system-mt.dylib:
    /usr/local/lib/libboost_system-mt.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
    /usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 120.0.0)
    /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 119
Hmm, do you have a boost framework around somewhere else? Could you please also paste the output of otool -LD on the bitcoin-qt binary, _before_ running the deployment script?\n

```
$ otool -LD src/qt/bitcoin-qt
src/qt/bitcoin-qt:
    /usr/local/lib/libboost_system.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
    /usr/local/lib/libboost_filesystem.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
    /usr/local/lib/libboost_program_options-mt.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
    /usr/local/lib/libboost_thread-mt.dylib

I set some breakpoints in the macdeploy script and found out that the `@loader_path/libboost_system-mt.dylib` framework gets brought in as a dependency when calling `getFrameworks`  with `/usr/local/lib/libboost_thread-mt.dylib`. Not sure if that helps.\n
I don't know anything about MacOSX building. @theuni does it make sense to merge this?\n
ping @theuni should we merge this or are you working on another fix?\n
I've repro'd the issue here, will post a fix.\n

@federicobond Could you please give this a shot? If it works fine, you can just update this PR with it.

``` patch
diff --git a/contrib/macdeploy/macdeployqtplus b/contrib/macdeploy/macdeployqtplus
index ce4169a..b710806 100755
--- a/contrib/macdeploy/macdeployqtplus
+++ b/contrib/macdeploy/macdeployqtplus
@@ -211,6 +211,7 @@ def getFrameworks(binaryPath, verbose):

     libraries = []

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4190_502972f16bae79cf025bf9b63ec8276bc4a236bb/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
@federicobond Thanks. And thanks for tracking down the culprit.\n@laanwj good to go now.\n
